House Bill/Resolution NO. PS00076
FULL TITLE : STRESSED THE NEED TO STRENGTHEN VOLUNTARY ACCREDITATION AMONG HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS
SHORT TITLE : Voluntary Accreditation System; Quality Of The Country's Higher Education
ABSTRACT : . . . Rep. Olivarez stressed the need to strengthen voluntary accreditation among higher education institutions (HEIs) in order for the country to cope with global competitiveness. He cited facts and figures on the number of HEIs in the country and their student population, the low passing rate in licensure examinations,the small percentage of master’s degree-holders among college faculty, and the warning among the business community on the economic impact of inadequately trained and prepared graduates...; also discussed Memo Order No. 1 (2005) of the CHED on the policies and guidelines on accreditation and described what was being done about accreditation in the context of the ASEAN community...; stated that he would file a measure to strengthen voluntary accreditation in the Philippines by institutionalizing its existing policies and practices and providing financial assistance therefor. (SOURCE: House Journal No.23,p.15)
